results.title: Production unlimited
results.creator_credit: R.V. Edwards, Robert Parker and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Surveys the rapid development of Australian secondary industries, more than doubling output since 1939, with particular reference to the light engineering field.

results.title: Production systems. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Examines several different case studies on plant production systems. The environment can be manipulated to produce seedlings for retail nurseries, while vegetable seedlings are produced in large quantities needed by growers. Demonstrates hydroponics in a controlled environment being used to grow tomatoes and micro-propogating techniques. Explains how salt-tolerant plants can be cloned, using tissue culture methods to rapidly produce large numbers of plants suitable for use in high salinity areas.

results.title: Production systems. - 1.
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
The principles applied to commercial plant production are studied by the examination of three case studies. The first is pasture management, where with expert help, resources must be carefully managed to ensure the quality of diary produce. The second case study highlights broad-acre crops, a six year cycle of crop rotation and crop diversity to ensure better economic returns. Lastly, the focus turns to modern orchards and their design in order to ensure increased yields and good crop management.
